content.question:
<math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>
<math alttext="0 less than x less than 1"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></math>
<math alttext="1 less than x less than 2"><mn>1</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></math>
<math alttext="2 less than x less than 3"><mn>2</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn></math>
<math alttext="3 less than x less than 4"><mn>3</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn></math>
Rate of change of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> on the interval of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>
Increasing
Positive and Constant
Decreasing
Negative and Constant

​The table describes rates of change of a function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> for selected intervals of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>. The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is defined for <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less or equal than 4"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. On which of the following intervals is the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> concave down?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="0 less than x less than 1"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></math>
​<math alttext="1 less than x less than 2"><mn>1</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></math>
​<math alttext="2 less than x less than 3"><mn>2</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn></math>
​<math alttext="3 less than x less than 4"><mn>3</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="2 less than x less than 3"><mn>2</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
